title: github: workflow: GitHub Actions comment bot to help users check CI failures
body:
Reference the below link for the how to read the CI section

https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/master/docs/contributing/git.rst#how-to-read-the-ci

this section should be converted from restructuredtext to markdown

the new markdown document should be included under the index.rst table of contents within the docs/contributing directory

in GitHub actions workflow should be created which looks for completions of CI jobs for pull requests

the action should check if there are any failing jobs if there are not any failing jobs the action should do nothing

if there are any failing jobs the action should create a comment containing the following information

- [ ] the contents of the new markdown file which describes how to read the CI

- [ ] the action should check the failing CI jobs against the list of issues labeled with kind/ci/failing. If there are any entries in both less the workflow should provide a message saying that these CI jobs might possibly be failing for these known issues

- [ ] finally the workflow should list each failing job with a link to the report
